events.name: Chief Data & Analytics Officer Singapore 2017 - Day 1
events.description: Chief Data & Analytics Officer Singapore 2017 - Day 1, a 2 day event hosted by Corinium Global Intelligence. You must register with the event to book your seat. Description: "Growth, Return & Innovation: Unlocking Data as a Strategic Asset" More information: https://www.chiefdataanalyticsofficersingapore.com/ Agenda: Tuesday, July 25 08:15- 08:50 - Registration, Coffee & Networking08:50- 09:00 - Chair’s Opening Remarks09:00- 09:15 - Audience Interactive Icebreaker: What does Data Analytics Mean for your Organisation?09:15- 09:40 - Opening Observations – The Smart Use of Data09:40- 10:05 - International Keynote Presentation: Harnessing Data for Gains in Performance, Productivity, Cost Savings, and Revenue Enhancement10:05- 10:30 - Making Data Talk – Converting Complexity into Simplicity10:30- 11:00 - Coffee & Networking11:00- 11:25 - Keynote Presentation: Data Governance – How to Thrive on it!11:25- 12:00 - Keynote Panel Discussion: Data Driven Leaders12:00- 12:25 - Keynote Presentation: Driving Innovation, Agility and Business Value with Data12:25- 13:25 - Buffet Lunch & Networking in the Exhibition Area13:35- 14:10 - Discussion Group: Getting the Building Blocks Right – Data Quality, Governance and Centralisation14:10- 14:45 - Discussion Group: The Power of Marrying Structured and Unstructured Data to Impact the Customer Experience13:35- 14:10 - Presentation – Self-Serve Analytics: Wrong Solution to the Wrong Problem?14:10- 14:45 - Discussion Group: Tips for Building Your Analytic Capability14:45- 15:15 - Coffee & Networking15:15- 15:40 - Keynote Presentation: Effective Frameworks for Data Governance and Quality15:40- 16:00 - Keynote Interview Session: Privacy and EthicsConsent, intent and the moving goal posts around data privacy. Compliance and ethics – how much data and analytics is too much? Update: what are the best practices and industry standards for data governance, framework and policy?16:00- 16:25 - Keynote Presentation: How Analytics Drives Decision Support for New Age Banks16:25- 16:50 - Keynote Presentation: A Single View of the Customer – Building Smarter Organisations16:50- 17:00 - Chair’s Day One Closing Remarks ****You must register with the event to book your seat**** Register here: https://www.chiefdataanalyticsofficersingapore.com/book-now/ For deeper engagement with Apache Apex, download, view past meetup webinars, slides, and docs.  To reduce time to market, look at operable app-templates that you can quickly import and launch.  Examples: HDFS-Sync, Kafka-HDFS, HDFS-Line-Copy, S3-HDFS and HDFS-Kafka. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.

events.name: Get Ready for VMware Advance Seminar
events.description:
Target Audience: 
 • IT Professionals  • Business Partners (PreSales, Engineers, Technical Consultants)

Session One (9.30am – 12.30pm) - Get Ready for vSphere & NSX Advance Courses
vSphere Advanced & Troubleshooting • Strong understanding of the interdependencies of the resources consumed by VMs and the vSphere infrastructure tuning and management required to deliver a reliable, available and efficient SDDC foundation  • Learning actual vSphere Troubleshooting methodologies with real-world problem isolation, identification and resolution   NSX Overview • VMware’s network virtualization platform, NSX, deploys on top of existing physical network hardware and supports the newest fabrics and geometries from all vendors   Education & Certification Overview • Familiarize with VMware official courses and certifications paths

Session Two (2.00pm – 4.30pm) - Accelerating Your Solution Competency
NSX ICM and Design • What to expect from these two trainings in preparing business partners to provide end to end services to customers   vRA ICM and Design  • What to expect from these two trainings in preparing business partners to provide end to end services to customers   Education & Certification Overview • Familiarize with VMware official courses and certifications paths
events.location: Devan Nair Institute, Jurong, 80 Jurong East Street 21 #04-04 Devan Nair Institute, Singapore 609607

events.name: Gerrit and Jenkins and Docker
events.description:
Agenda 6.30pm to 7.00pm Eat, drink & chit-chat7.00pm to 7.45pm Topic 17.45pm to 8.00pm Break & chit-chat8.00pm to 8.45pm Topic 28.45pm to 9.00pm Q&A 


Topic 1: Gerrit and Jenkins – Bringing in code review into delivery pipeline  Incorporating code review system into the development workflow one would not only save time spent in rework in the long run, but also align the organizations to devops practices with shift left and automated test model. When git is being used as the number one source control tool in the world, gerrit offers a solid code review platform which also integrates well with Jenkins making it easy to add to the delivery pipeline. This talk is a introduction to how to start using gerrit and integrate it into the build pipeline and covers the following topics. • What is Gerrit?• Setting up Code Reviews for git repos with Gerrit• Bringing in Jenkins for automated Verification• Gerrit Jenkins Trigger Plugin• Demonstration of a Build Pipeline with Gerrit, Jenkins and More 


Topic 2: Containerized Software Delivery – Jenkins and Docker Docker, along with open container eco system, is changing the way we build, ship and run software. It is also standardizing software delivery. With more and more organizations adopting docker, its essential to understand how the delivery pipeline would look like with Jenkins working along with Dockerfiles, Compose, Swarm etc. This session would demonstrate you the power of Docker along with Jenkins. • Overview of Open Container Eco System• Demo of docker based delivery to production and pre production environments• Dockerfiles, Compose, Swarm 


About the Speaker Gourav ShahFounder, School of Devops, Initcron Systems Being passionate about world of Open Source software, and later managing systems at scale, Gourav has transformed himself to be an expert Devops Enabler. He has trained more than 2000 IT professionals from leading tech firms including Visa, CISCO, Intuit, Walmart Labs, Dreamworks, Accenture, Australia and Newzeland Bank, Societe Gererale Group, ICT or Sri Lanka, Cognizant, Capgemini, RBS, Wells Fargo, Oracle etc. making him a coveted devops trainer. After heading IT Ops team for one of the successful silicon valley venture, he went on to launch Initcron Systems, a niche firm specialized in devops and cloud and School of Devops, a leading provider of devops education. He is the author of “Ansible Playbook Essentials” published by PACKT. Gourav evangelizes about Devops, Cloud and Automation Tools at various events, meetups and conferences. He has initiated Devops meetups in Pune, Mumbai and Delhi and is an active member/speaker at Devops Bangalore. Profile • http://in.linkedin.com/in/gouravshah• www.gouravshah.com• www.schooofdevops.com Publications

events.name: SharePoint Community - July 2017
events.description: Join our next meetup and learn about some of the new features in Office 365, Stream and Communication Sites! Microsoft Stream is Microsoft's new intelligent enterprise video service that makes it easy for people inside any organization to securely upload, share, manage and view videos. Communication sites are perfect for internal cross-company campaigns, weekly and monthly reports or status updates, product launches, events and more See both of these new functionalities live in action with few slides and lots of demos. About the presenter:Rene Modery is a Microsoft Office Servers and Services MVP, working as a Solutions Architect (SharePoint, Office 365, Azure, AWS) in Singapore
events.location: Microsoft Operations Pte Ltd, 22CF12, Level 22, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: #9 Designer's Journey - From Architect to Sociology
events.description: Designers come from diverse backgrounds, and work in broader and wider industries than ever before. In the article 'Design for Action' in HBR, Tim Brown and Roger L. Martin talk about how broad the designer's roles have expanded in various places, and how design culture has started to be integrated as part of the processes in many firms. At this meetup, we will invite two intellectuals who have paved their unique way to become a design professional. Agenda:  • Opening / Introduction by Julee • Designing vehicles: an uncharted path beyond Architecture by Colin Choo After his six years of Architectural studies, Colin was expected to get a job with his Master of Architecture.  He was expected to be drawing buildings. Except that Colin did the unexpected - he advanced right up to the final stage of Architecture before diverting from the expected path. He is now designing vehicles at HOPE Technik, where he penned the design of four versions of the Tumbler Element (also known as the ‘Red Rhino’ fire truck in Singapore) and many others. Find out why he thinks that even though he had pulled the plug on Architecture, Architecture was in fact what led him to become a vehicle designer today. • My Journey from Sociology into Business Ecosystems by Nazish Zafar Sociologists & anthropologists examine how our lives are shaped by society, and their research is often focused on uncovering these 'invisible' structures of influence.  Nazish will share some of the interesting projects she has done around the world, such as the study of orphanages in Russia, public health education in Brazil, interviewing families in high poverty neighbourhoods in Baltimore and, most recently, examining the small business and start-up economy in Singapore.  With a decade of academic research in Sociology, she shows us how she is applying her skills to the sphere of design thinking, with practical takeaways for everyone. • Q & A with speakers ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Speaker's Bio:  Colin Choo Colin holds the role of Artistic Manager at HOPE Technik where he determines design directions for the company’s various products ranging from emergency response vehicles to unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). His involvement with HOPE Technik’s projects began in 2008 when he collaborated to design the first generation of the Tumbler Element – the vehicle that became the company’s flagship firefighting vehicle supporting Singapore’s fire department services. Since then, Colin has gone on to serve as lead product designer for the subsequent three generations of the Tumbler Element as well as for all of HOPE Technik’s emergency response vehicles.  Before his tenure at HOPE Technik, Colin spent several years honing his skills in architecture design after graduating from the National University of Singapore with a Master of Architecture, where he was placed on Dean’s list twice and awarded the Ramalingam Gold Medal for distinguished academic performance.  While working on various mixed-use, residential and industrial projects in Singapore and China, he actively pursued his interest in vehicle design. His design, the ‘Peugeot Blade’, was shortlisted as one of the top 25 finalists of the prestigious International Peugeot design competition in 2008. He was also the only Singapore representative shortlisted in the competition.  Nazish Zafar Nazish Zafar is a sociologist who completed her PhD at Johns Hopkins University. Her research was about the survival and growth of small businesses, and she explored the role of the government in the small business economy.  During her research, Nazish launched a series of photographic essays online called Shopkeeper Stories featuring interviews with business owners from a wide variety of trades (including florists, tech entrepreneurs, lawyers, and more). In 2015, she published a coffeetable book, and continues to publish photographic essays on her blog. Nazish specialises in qualitative research and has done a wide range of projects in Brazil, Russia, the United States, and Singapore.
